intro: Lithocarpus elmerrillii, commonly known as the Elmerrill's stone栎, is a species of evergreen tree native to the mountainous regions of southern China and northern Vietnam. The plant produces small, inedible nuts enclosed in a thick, woody husk, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. Due to its ecological significance and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable but rare species in its native habitat.
